A Collection of Notes for Modern Marketers:

Select your topic(s) below:

Data see all

  • Tell a story that translates Google Ads reports into action article

    If you’re new to reporting, check out this article and short video for some ideas to kickstart your dashboards.

    added 11/17/17visit

  • reddit.com/r/dataisbeautiful resource

    I check this subreddit periodically for new ideas on data visualization. You’ll find the work of some very talented data scientists here.

    added 08/23/17visit

  • Visualizing Clusters of Clickbait Headlines article

    Step by step guide to a 100,000+ headline analysis of clickbait using Apache Spark and Word2vec by Max Woolf.

    added 11/17/16visit

Design see all

  • Design Trend: A Look at Memphis Style Then and Now article

    It’s making a come back, and I’m sure parts of it influenced the development of this site. Pure nostalgia from the 90’s.

    added 05/16/18visit

  • A Complete Guide to Grid resource

    A basic guide to one of the newer web dev features, CSS Grid Layout.

    added 04/15/18visit

  • Realizing Common Layouts using CSS Grid resource

    Copy/pastable copy to help you get started using grid with common website layouts.

    added 04/15/18visit

  • Zeitung Flex resource

    One of the first flex fonts that allows you to programmatically update the font weight.

    added 04/04/18visit

  • Why "Simple" Websites Are Scientifically Better article

    The cognitive reasoning behind why less visually complex websites convert better.

    added 03/15/18visit

Email see all

  • Manage Multiple Mailchimp Accounts with One Login resource

    An issue that plagues digital marketing agencies that use MailChimp but don’t have it set up.

    added 09/19/18visit

PPC see all

  • Advanced Tactics for Dynamic Search Ads resource

    Dynamic Search Ads are something I’ve been utilizing more regularly, specifically in conjuction with remarketing audiences. This article gives a good introduction to some other targeting options.

    added 10/02/18visit

  • Script: A time-saving free script to help keep Ad Grants accounts out of trouble tool

    Fred from Optmyzr has a whole host of scripts he encourages Optmyzr’s clients to use. Here’s a freebie for those who are working with Ad Grants Accounts.

    added 06/26/18visit

  • Script: Link Checker - Single Account tool

    Ever have a web dev that didn’t let you know the site was down? This script notifies you when sites are down so you can pause campaigns.

    added 06/25/18visit

  • The Complete AdWords Audit Part 11: The Lin-Rodnitzky Ratio resource

    If I only had 30 seconds to audit an account, this is what I would look at. This two variable ratio tells you how well a paid search campaign is optimized.

    added 06/20/18visit

  • Sarcasm aside, how strict PPC advertiser policies may actually benefit us article

    Over the past little while, Google has made significant changes to PPC policy. I’ve had my own frustrations, but maybe it’s for the best?

    added 04/19/18visit

People see all

  • Aligning Sales & Marketing with Intercom (podcast) resource

    Excellent listen or read on how sales and marketing can collaborate to create a joint “revenue plan.” Featuring Intercom’s Bryan Kotlyar and Jeff Serlin.

    added 10/03/18visit

  • How To Prototype Organizational Change article

    Signed up for the webinar but haven’t tuned in yet. Saved for later use.

    added 09/20/18visit

  • 16 Personalities: NERIS Type Explorer tool

    A free variant of the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator test, useful to help teams understand how to better interact with each other.

    added 10/31/17visit

SEO see all

  • Google's Medic Update: How to fix your website if you were hit article

    One of the better recovery guides for the August 2018 algo update named “Medic”. If you’re seeing drops some time around there, check this one out.

    added 09/26/18visit

  • How to Start a Blog in The Most Cluttered Marketplace In History article

    Content Strategy: what you should write about, how often, and where. Applicable for individual bloggers and organizations looking to implement a content strategy.

    added 09/24/18visit

  • On-page SEO for Natural Language Processing (NLP) article

    How to use Google’s Cloud Natural Language platform to optimize your on-page SEO for machine-readable content.

    added 07/17/18visit

  • 119 Examples of 10X Content (by Rand Fishkin) resource

    Good content should be 10X better than the rest. Here’s Rand Fishkin’s big ol’ list of examples of good content.

    added 07/17/18visit

  • Technical SEO in 2018. article

    Title says it. Three main categories: Mobile First, JavaScript Indexing, and Performance as a ranking factor. By one of the leading experts in JavaScript SEO, Bartosz Goralewicz of Elephate.

    added 05/28/18visit
